ACT
204
Proclamation of the will
When the court where the will is found determines that the person who left the will has died or has been declared dead, it will open the will without damaging the seal, read it and make a record of it.
The court will act in the manner referred to in paragraph 1 of this article regardless of whether the will is valid and regardless of whether there are more than one will.
The will will be opened and read in the presence of two persons, who may also be heirs.
The promulgation of the will may be attended by heirs, recorders and other persons who exercise a right from the estate and request a copy of the will.
The municipal court to which it was handed over will open and read the will even when another municipal court or a foreign body is competent for probate proceedings.
